intro: Faramea paulensis, commonly known as the Brazilian evergreen shrub, is a species native to the Atlantic Forest region of Brazil. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and economically important plants. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a glossy green surface with prominent veins. Faramea paulensis produces small, clustered white flowers that are followed by bright red berries, which are an important food source for local wildlife.
